happy.verse: So remember Me; I will remember you. (2:152)
And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied. (93:5)
They said, Call upon your Lord to show us what is her color. He said, He says, It is a yellow cow, bright in color - pleasing to the observers. (2:69)

Allah has promised the believing men and believing women gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence; but approval from Allah is greater. It is that which is the great attainment. (9:72)
The Day it comes no soul will speak except by His permission. And among them will be the wretched and the prosperous. (11:105)

And as for those who were [destined to be] prosperous, they will be in Paradise, abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will - a bestowal uninterrupted. (11:108)

sad.verse: Do not despair of the mercy of Allah. (39:53)
And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. (17:31)
And do not grieve over what they conspire. (16:127)
And do not be grieved by what they say. (36:76)
And do not be grieved by their speech. (5:41)
And do not be grieved over them or be in distress from what they conspire. (16:127)
And do not let your souls be consumed by grief for them. (60:13)

angry.verse: The path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor, not of those who have evoked [Your] anger or of those who are astray.(1:7)

How wretched is that for which they sold themselves - that they would disbelieve in what Allah has revealed through [their] outrage that Allah would send down His favor upon whom He wills from among His servants. So they returned having [earned] wrath upon wrath. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.(2:90)

They have been put under humiliation [by Allah] wherever they are overtaken, except for a covenant from Allah and a rope from the Muslims. And they have drawn upon themselves anger from Allah and have been put under destitution. That is because they disbelieved in the verses of Allah and killed the prophets without right. That is because they disobeyed and [habitually] transgressed.(3:112)
Who spend [in the cause of Allah] during ease and hardship and who restrain anger and who pardon the people - and Allah loves the doers of good;(3:134)

But whoever kills a believer intentionally - his recompense is Hell, wherein he will abide eternally, and Allah has become angry with him and has cursed him and has prepared for him a great punishment.(4:93)

anxious.verse: O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.(2:153)

And [remember, O Muhammad], when those who disbelieved plotted against you to restrain you or kill you or evict you [from Makkah]. But they plan, and Allah plans. And Allah is the best of planners.(8:30)
Those who have believed and whose hearts are assured by the remembrance of Allah. Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allah hearts are assured.(13:28)
